p: In general, first and second-generation HCV anti-proteases tend to show selectivity for genotypes 1 and 2. 10, 34 Consequently, it was important to determine whether MPPs behaved in a similar fashion. We tested whether CoPP and ZnPP inhibited NS3-4A constructs from genotype 1A, 1B, 2A, and 3A viruses ( Figure 4A and B, respectively). Both MPPs showed protease inhibition plots and IC 50 values that were statistically indistinguishable across the four tested genotypes. These findings suggest that the antiviral activities of MPPs are versatile across HCV genotypes and that the MPPs may also be useful for related viruses.
